benchmark_details.name: PsyCrisisBench
benchmark_details.overview: PsyCrisisBench is a comprehensive benchmark of 540 annotated transcripts from the Hangzhou Psychological Assistance Hotline, assessing four critical tasks: mood status recognition, suicidal ideation detection, suicide plan identification, and risk assessment.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate large language models in crisis triage, particularly for psychological support hotlines.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Mood status recognition remains limited due to contextual and paralinguistic complexity.

data.annotation: Transcripts were manually annotated for mood status, suicidal ideation, suicide plan, and risk level.

methodology.calculation: F1 Score is calculated to balance precision and recall, particularly crucial for sensitive scenarios like crisis assessment.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 Scores indicate better model performance on the tasks of detecting suicidal ideation and assessing risk.
methodology.validation: Evaluation was repeated three times to ensure stability and reliability of results.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Callers are informed that conversations will be recorded and anonymously documented for research purposes.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Ethical approval was received, and callers were informed about data usage.
